source.f8feecd4:
# Save your time, submit without kernel inference

This kernel just demonstrates the discussion [Reduce submission time to ~10-15 minutes](https://www.kaggle.com/c/lyft-motion-prediction-autonomous-vehicles/discussion/177662) introduced by Peter(@pestipeti).

The competition test dataset is provided as dataset.
So if we have `submission.csv` predicted locally or by other kernel, we can just submit it.
source.bf6422e8: Here it is. We just need to copy it to current directory as output.
source.f35f5213:
# Import already calculated submission.csv as Dataset

We have 2 choices to prepare dataset:

 - 1. Upload calculated submission.csv file (maybe from local machine) as Dataset and use it
 - 2. Use other kernel's dataset (it can be either your own kernel, or any other public kernel)

Here I will demonstrate case2, let me use the best performing kernel's result, from [Pytorch Baseline - Inference](https://www.kaggle.com/pestipeti/pytorch-baseline-inference) again by Peter.

We can choose "Add Data" on right side bar and choose "Kernel Output Files" to search the kernel and add its kernel's output as Dataset of this kernel's input.
For me the most easiest way to find the kernel is to upvote the kernel you want to use, and filter it as "Your Favorites" at search botton. Upvote his kernel! :)
source.e1b1373c: That's all! Please enjoy submission without waiting long time:) However please note that use this method only for checking LB score, I guess final submission should not be done in this way, it must contain inference code.
